column5: Does any body know what the water temps are like in the kawartha's or more specifically the tri-lakes? Are the weeds still green? Thanks.

Last Wednesday Lake Cameron outside Fenelon Falls was in the high 60's, 68 I believe. Put my hand in the water and it did feel warm for September  Smallies were hitting all day off the weed lines and humps
That reply is about right. The temp may drop a little with this weather we're getting here  right now, but it won't be less than 65. Lots of green weeds, look deep.  Sinker
Just checked and the waters 67 on sturgeon. I would say that the weeds are the greenest that they have been all year and still growing in some places. Cheers jeff
I was out on Chemong, Buckhorn and Pigeon yesterday and surface temps were all right at the 70 deg mark.
